name: 3DMark PCI Express Feature Test
detailed_description:
PCI Express (PCIe) is a standard interface that provides high-bandwidth communication between devices in a computer. New PCI Express 4.0 interfaces provide up to twice the bandwidth of PCI Express 3.0. With more bandwidth, games can transfer more data, reduce loading times, and support more complex scenes.

This 3DMark feature test measures the bandwidth available to your GPU over your system's PCI Express interface.

  • Measure the bandwidth available to your GPU over PCIe.
  • Test the performance of the latest PCIe 4.0 hardware.
  • Compare the bandwidth of PCIe 4.0 and PCIe 3.0 interfaces.

short_description: Test the PCI Express bandwidth performance of your PC.
supported_languages: English, German, Simplified Chinese, Russian, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Korean

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS:Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor:Dual-core processor
  • Graphics:Dedicated graphics card with DirectX 12 support

You need a DirectX 12 compatible discrete graphics card to run this test. The test will not run on systems that have only integrated graphics. External GPU enclosures are not supported.
